content.rendered:
A range of rich, ornate, non-minimalist packaging projects this week, with work from Manila, Auckland, and Glasgow.

Archipelago by And A Half

Archipelago is a new range of gins produced by Full Circle Craft Distillers in the Philippines. The packaging, designed by Manila-based And A Half, is rich and ornate from top to bottom, starting with the illustrated letters that make up the name, where each detailed illustration depicts a step of the gin-making process. Only the “ARC” made it unto the bottle but the full set is beautiful and it’s also amazing how well they work in a single color. The labels are unapologetically dense and they give the gin an exotic look that make it clear this isn’t your typical spirit. See full project

Manuka Emporium by Onfire

Manuka Emporium is a seasonal, small batch producer of honey in the remote Manuka bush areas in Northland New Zealand. The packaging, designed by Auckland, New Zealand-based Onfire, takes cues from premium liquor brands to create a Victorian aesthetic for these small but mighty jars. The titular type treatment is pretty nice and the combination of multiple other fonts in the label add up to a contemporary spin on the Victorian aesthetic. The groovy bee icon on the lids literally seals the deal. See full project

Thornbridge Brewery by Thirst

Thornbridge Brewery gets its name from, one, being a brewery and, two, from having started on the grounds of Thornbridge Hall, a large English country house with its own Wikipedia entry. Established in 2005, Thornbridge Brewery has grown into a significant craft brewer distributing bottled, canned, and keg’d beers as well as operating nine pubs. Their new packaging, designed by Glasgow, UK-based Thirst, revolves around a simplified design of a decorative detail found on the fireplace’s mantelpiece of Thornbridge Hall. Neatly abstracted into a thin-line drawing, the design is complemented with a lovely condensed flared serif font and delivered in a range of sumptuous colors. The way the names of the beers stand out in white from the colorful backgrounds is a great way to get attention as the brewery gets into the can game for the first time. See full project
